column1: review/summary: Warning: will cause bad breathe (but oh

column1:
review/text: These chips are very very good. The flavoring on them is the perfect bbq flavor. Unfortunately they leave you with terrible breath (maybe don't eat them before going in for a kiss or talking in someone's face!).

They have an odd crisp that's unsettling at first
column2: but if you give it a try
column3: you get used to it
column4: and will most likely enjoy it. You eat them expecting that crunch of a potato chip
column5:
but are greeted by something more airy. It's a pretty unique texture that's not much like what I've eaten before.

They are not baked or fried
column6:
but popped. Which means less calories and fat. They also seem to have the ability to fill me up even though the bag is small (smaller than most I think). So that is a double win.

I'd highly recommend trying these in store before investing in a big box of these unless you are adventurous (or generous enough to give away if they displease you)...but DO try them!

column1: review/text: I really like these. One reviewer mentioned they have soy in them. The last ingredient in them is soy lecithin (emulsifier)which is in many store bought foods. They are quite salty and on the rare occasion when I made a pig of myself and ate the whole bag it made my tongue sore. They are really good though. I bought mine at Trader Joe's but am delighted to find them now at Amazon (for only 11 cents more a bag) as it is a pain to go shopping and have to get my wheelchair in and out of the car. I plan to order some right now.A great alternative to greasy regular potato chips.

column1: review/summary: THESE HAVE CHANGED....AND NOT FOR THE BETTER!
review/text: Let me start by saying that I have purchased Popchips for several years. I was even on Amazon autoship for 2 boxes every 2 months because we enjoyed them so much. That being said
column2: I have been very disappointed with the last 2 shipments received. The barbeque had little to no seasoning on both boxes of both shipments. Not to.mention that the bags are now half filled with air. The bad thing about this is that both shipments came from different plants. I was so dissapointed with this last batch that I attempted to return them
column3: but Amazon does not accept food returns. I have canceled both autoships and I won't buy them again until I am assured that this problem has been corrected. LISTEN UP POPCHIPS: YOUR LOYAL CUSTOMERS WANT THE PRODUCT THAT WE ARE ACCUSTOMED TO CONSUMMING. IF I WANTED ORIGINAL FLAVOR CHIPS I WOULD HAVE ORDERED THEM. I WANT MY BARBEQUE CHIPS TO TASTE LIKE BARBEQUE. YOU HAVE LOST A VERY LOYAL CUSTOMER WITH YOUR COST CUTTING EFFORTS :(

column8: no preservatives or artificial flavors and colors

there's nothing in here for me to complain about.

1 bag is only 100 calories (30 from fat)
column10: which is about 1/3 less than regular potato chips. I could eat the whole thing without feeling guilty. The salt and pepper taste is very pronounced and adds a really nice bite to the chips. When I was done
column11:
I found myself running my finger through the inside to pick up the remaining seasoning bits and crumbs.

I've tried the BBQ flavor as well as several of the others. This one is my favorite. Highly highly recommended.

column1: review/text: Love these chips. Good taste

column1: review/text: Popchips are a perfect late afternoon snack.  Gives me the energy I need for a few more hours.  I have it set up for periodic automatic shipments.

column2: these chips are wonderful. They are not greasy

column5: even at $3 a bag. Worse
column6: even when in stock
column7: I am lucky to find more than a few bags at a time in the store. I hate making the special trip just for the chips
column8: particularly when I often find the shelf empty. Problem solved -- Amazon's are much more reasonably priced and I can stock up -- and this snack is as close in flavor to actual potato chips that I've found to date.

column1: review/summary: LOVE these with one caveat

column3: and flavors. The only thing that kept me from a higher star rating is the choice of oil they used to coat the chips. I have NO PROBLEM with oil as I believe fat is GOOD for us and the great thing is they coat the chips with oil AFTER they heat them so they don't create free radicals. That said
column4: the ingredient list says
column5: "sunflower
column6: safflower
column7:
and/or canola oil." Hmmmm... that's not very definitive!

Sunflower and safflower oil are good but canola is a FRANKENFOOD that I don't want my kids to eat. Sigh... a yummy possibility spoiled by canola oil.

The chips are not gross. They taste like sweet potatos which to me means they need some butter flavor added  to make them taste good.  As it stands
column2:
they taste like an unflavored bake potatoe without any butter.

I tried to eat a whole bag and they kept getting stuck in my teeth so I gave up. Also
column3:
it just doesn't feel right to be eating sweet potato chips. I have a whole box of them so I am going to continue to try to get used to them.
====

Update: I still have a box of these chips left. I couldn't stomach them

and my friend co-worker said they taste like unflavored cornflakes.

I don't see how these will be a hit in stores.

column1: review/summary: Yummy goodies!  But are they any healthier?
review/text: Yum! Yum!  I liked these and they are certainly yummy chips.  They are a tad sweet and a tad salty mixed.  I guess they are more sweet than salty
column2: though. Why only four stars?  These are like Pringles or Munchos in that they take mashed potato product (in this case
column3: sweet potato)
column4: and form them into shapes and bake (excuse me
column5: "pop") them.  I would have liked these better (and they would be more healthy) had they been from whole sweet potatoes and then chipped and baked. Most of the good nutritional value of the Sweet Potato has been lost
column6: I would imagine.  Still
column7: a tastey treat that is certainly not terribly bad for you!  :)

column1: review/text: The first time I tried this I thought
column2: wow
column3: this is great! It's as satisfying as eating regular potato chips
column4: but sweeter and presumably healthier. So had I written the review then I would have given it 5 stars. The reason I hesitated was that I took it with me to work
column5: and the more I tried it
column6: the more I began to question the sweetness. There's no question that sweet potatoes are slightly sweet
column7: but I felt it only fair to let readers know that they might find this product to be TOO sweet. Hence the reason for the 4 stars. It is still quite good
column8: but if you find sweetness to be cloying
column9: you might not like this product for long. But all in all
column10: I would still recommend it.

column1: review/text: I am always looking for healthy
column2: low calorie snacks

column5: and not baked

column7:
I thought I would give these a try.

The first thing I noticed was the color. They looked a bit lighter in color to other sweet potato chips I have tried
column8: and I think this is due to them not being fried.  They really looked the same color as fresh
column9: cooked sweet potatoes.  I did not notice any particular smell
column10:
other than good old sweet potatoes. So far so good.

In terms of taste
column11: I thought they tasted great.  The chips were nice and crispy
column12: with only a hint of salt
column13: so you really got to enjoy the naturally sweet flavor.  I can really see that these will help satisfy cravings for something crunchy
column14: something salty
column15: something sweet
column16:
and especially something that is all three.

The texture is definitely not that of a typical potato chip. They are lighter
column17: crisper
column18: and airy
column19: not as dense as a rice cake
column20: but not as greasy as a typical chip.  All in all
column21: I was really pleased with them.  Someone looking for a healthy replacement
column22: or enjoys other veggie chip type snacks would really like these
column23: I think.  For a die hard chip lover
column24: these would might not satisfy you upon first taste
column25:
but give them a couple of chances; personally I loved them.

With the snack size bag being 100 calories
column26: I am pretty sold on these as a healthy snack alternative.  This would be a great addition to a sandwich for lunch
column27: or an in-between meal snack.  I am happy to add Popchips to my snack rotation.

review/text: We frequent Whole Foods and love to buy the larger "Pop Chips" that they make. They are about 7 inches across and so unbelievable crispy! We like to eat them more for fun than anything.

column2:
I was excited. The size of each chip is about that of a potato chip. The bag is 100 calories (3 Weight Watchers +Points if you are calculating).

The first thing I noticed is the sweet
column3:
followed by salty of the chip. Second is the crunch that is oh-so satisfying! My 5 year old just loved them while my 8 year old wasn't so hip to the flavor.

There is a distinct sweet potato flavor
column4: where the sweet comes in. There are also some other spices that I can't place
column5: but the taste is not spicy hot
column6: is considerably salty. I like them a lot and will continue to buy them to satisfy that late night or mid afternoon need for a crispy

column1: review/summary: Great crispy crunch and flavor
review/text: My family is addicted to crispy
column2:
salty snacks and I've tried a few different kinds of chips trying to find a healthier alternative to the junk food they all love.

I like the Terra Krinkle Cut Sweet Potato Sea Salt chips for their high level of vitamin A. But they are also high fat
column3:
and the texture and flavor don't appeal to my daughter.

These chips don't have any vitamin A according the to the label
column4: but they are low calorie
column5: low fat and low sodium. The texture and flavor are a definite hit with everyone in my family
column6:
even my very picky daughter.

The sweet potato chips aren't too sweet or too salty and they don't feel greasy at all. They are really crisp. The flavor is a little bland
column7:
but it also doesn't have the aftertaste that some vegetable chips can have.

The first ingredient listed on the chips is rice flour
column8:
not sweet potatoes.

I'd like these better if they had more going for them nutritionally. The Terra chips are higher in dietary fiber
column9:
vitamin A and C.

I plan to try some of the other flavors soon. I think they would be a wonderful topping for casseroles if they stay crispy enough.

column1: review/text: I've never been a big fan on chips. When it comes to snack foods
column2: I'm more of a pretzel guy
column3: or maybe something cheesy. Potato chips
column4: in particular
column5:
just never appealed to me. But these aren't potato chips.

If you read the bag
column6: and I'm one of those strange people that actually do read the bag
column7: you'll find out that these "chips" are not chips at all. They are neither fried
column8: nor baked; they are made similar to how cheese-puffs are made
column9: only in a way that results in a chip-like product
column10: rather than a puff. This gives them a really addictive
column11: crunching texture that keeps me going back for more. They pack a pretty good Sweet Potato flavor
column12:
with a noticeable sweetness balanced by saltiness and what I think are some subtle notes of spices like cinnamon. They're really tasty.

While I wouldn't exactly call this health food
column13: it's certainly not as bad as many traditional snack foods. Each individual bag is a serving and contains about 19 chips. The caloric price tag is 100 calories
column14: which is not bad at all
column15: especially considering nutritional payload is a respectable 3g of fat (none of which is saturated
column16: so it's "good" fat)
column17: and no cholesterol. More impressive is only 45mg of sodium and a mere 2g of sugar. Comparatively speaking
column18:
these are a pretty smart choice for a snack if you're worried about those kinds of things.

I was really happy to see the ingredients list was relatively short and contained no hydrogenated fats (sources of trans fatty acids)
column19: high fructose corn syrup (they use cane syrup
column20: which is preferable to me)
column21: or MSG. Rice flour
column22: dry sweet potatoes
column23: and tapioca are the biggest ingredients. As far as processed foods go
column24:
not bad at all.

I will definitely buy these again.

column1: review/text: I really liked these.  Great snack for someone watching their fat and or calorie intake.  Light
column2:
crunchy and full of flavor. They don't taste like a traditional chip they seem infused with air or something. The biggest problem for me would be if I bought the large bag I would be too tempted to eat way more than a serving. So these single sized bags are ideal.

Also should mention that the sweet potato variety that I tried do not contain any dairy which is a necessity for me and I'm sure others have similar issues.

column1: review/summary: These definitely taste like "diet" chips

review/text: After reading several reviews from people apparently on diets I now understand the high star rating because if you can't have the real thing something like this passes for good. These are bland
column2: have a weird texture and aren't very good. I will be sending these to work with my husband so he can give them away. I ate a few from my first and only bag before throwing them in the pantry. They are low in calories and low in taste. Pass.

I love Popchips. (BBQ are my absolute favs.) These are the chips I go for automatically at the store because of their crisp texture and great taste.

This review is for the Chili Lime Popchips.

They have a little heat for the Chili and a bit of acid for the Lime
column3: however

they left a bit of an unpleasant after taste coating the back of my throat. An after taste that lasted quite a while.

Since everyone loves different flavors

column10: the Chili Lime flavor rated a 3.  Not awful.  Not great.  Not on my shopping list.

column2: which is a big plus.  They  have a nice sweet potato flavor

I think that children would like these and they would certainly be a healthy alternative to other chips.  They are also gluten free...which seems to be a growing trend in foods today.  Overall
column5: I would definitively buy these chips again and look forward to trying other flavors of Popchips.

column1: review/summary: Satisfies a sweet potato tooth
review/text: Sweet potatoes are among my favorite vegetables
column2:
and I especially adore sweet potato chips. So an Amazon Vine offer of these chips seemed a sure bet.

They taste a bit like sweet potatoes
column3: yet ever so slightly sweeter --- with fewer calories and half the fat of a bag of real sweet potato chips (100 calories
column4: 30% from fat
column5:
compared to 130 calories with half from fat in a regular bag of chips).

But I agree with others. The taste is slightly strange --- and the ingredients tell why. The key ingredient isn't sweet potato
column6: but RICE FLOUR! Sweet potato flakes (whatever those are) come second
column7: then tapioca starch. Next comes oil (sunflower
column8: safflower
column9:
or canola) then yellow corn flour. And finally there's cane syrup --- sugar --- which explains why the chips seem a tad sweeter than sweet potatoes.

I like these Sweet Potato Popchips well enough
column10:
and will keep the box at the ready for brown bag lunches over the next several weeks.

I may buy them again
column11: too --- but only if no real sweet potato chips are available to satisfy my sweet potato tooth.

column1: review/profileName: Julie A. Dawson "Bards and Sages Publishing"

review/text: We got the sweet potato flavor through the Vine program.  I was genuinely surprised by how good these were.  Crunchy but light texture.  Just the right balance of sweet and salty.  Portion controlled bags have only a 100 calories and 95 mg of sodium.  These are definitely a healthier alternative to potato chips.  But don't mistake "healthier" for "healthy."  They have almost no nutritional value (1 g protein
column2: 2% iron).  So don't let all the buzzwords on the packaging fool you.  Still
column3: if you are looking for a light snack that won't ruin your diet
column4: this is a good choice.  As an FYI
column5: despite what the marketing and package language would lead you to believe
column6: sweet potato is not the main ingredient here.  Rice flour is the first ingredient
column7: followed by sweet potato flakes
column8: tapioca starch
column9: a blend of various oils
column10: corn flour
column11: seasonings
column12: etc. Not a huge deal
column13: but its one of those "truth in advertising" points that annoys me so I mention it.

column1: review/summary: Fabulous Taste - can't eat just one but small warning

review/text: These are absolutely delicious and irresistable. The taste is perfect - not heavy or overdone. It actually kind of sneaks up on you before you realize you've just finished the bag.

They seem to melt in your mouth even as you are chewing them as opposed to some brands that make you feel like Mr. Ed (the horse). Yes
column2: there is some salt
column3:
but it's not like someone just dumped a container of the stuff on them. This time it enhances the chip.

Everything in them is terrific except for the inclusion of maltodextrin about 2/3 down the ingredient list. It can have a kind of laxative effect on a lot of people and I just thought you should know it's in there.

Other than that - there is nothing about this product that would detract me from buying it for parties
column4: picnics
column5: events
column6:
or just enjoying by myself.

Seriously
column7: they are that good.

I love anything sweet potato so I opened the box eagerly and started chowing down.  They are delicious!  My only concern is that I don't really like the texture of anything "popped" but because the flavor is delicious I can overlook that.  These chips would work perfectly with many diet plans.  They are very crispy and although you won't confuse them with "real" chips they will satisfy that urge for something crunchy.  I'm going to buy them in several other flavors to keep on hand.

column1: review/text: POPCHIPS CHILI LIME POTATO is a crunchy potato chip
column2: that is not your grandfather's potato chip.  First
column3: for the positive comments.  The chips are salty
column4: but not so salty that you will experience a pressing urge to drink a cup of cool water.  The chips are crunchy and crisp
column5: but they do not produce several fragments when you break them.  In other words
column6: they break very cleanly.  Although the chips are a new product
column7: they resemble a traditional potato product where thin-sliced aged potatoes are first dipped in low temperature oil
column8: allowed to cool
column9: and then dipped in a high temperature oil
column10: where the high temperature provokes expansion resulting in a puffy potato.  This product apparently uses this type of technology
column11: not for ordinary sliced potatoes
column12: but for potato chips. Best of all
column13: this product is tangy with a slight hotness and a slight lime flavor.  The chips are round
column14: perhaps resembling a deflated bean bag chair
column15: and sprinkled with red dots.  The product is pleasant to the eye.  For those who become addicted to this product
column16: there is little need to worry about calorie overload.  The reason you don't have to worry about calorie overload is that the ratio of carbohydrates to fat is about 16 grams carbs/3 grams fat.  And now
column17: for the negative comments.  I have no negative comments about the POPCHIPS CHILI LIME POTATO product.

column1: review/summary: Taste more like "Tomato and Basil" than "Chili and Lime"

review/text: NOTE: This review is for the Chili and Lime Flavor Popchip. Amazon had a separate page for it but then merged the product and its reviews into one.

It's hard to objectively review food since everyone's palate and tastes are different. So what I can say about this particular Popchip flavor that should be useful for most folks out there is that it doesn't really taste like Chili and Lime you're "probably" expecting. The Chili and Lime most folks probably are expecting if they grew up on Frito Lay products is very sharp and sweet (and of course artificial) - but it's what we liked if we ate more than a bag.

The best way I can describe this flavor is that it has a "tomato" like taste to it with a somewhat tangy sour note that is suppose to be the lime component. Together they turn into an odd combination that registers other flavors in your mind than Chili and Lime - at least it did to me and others who tasted it with me. If you eat the skin of a green bell pepper
column2: you can kind of get at what Popchips were trying to do with the Chili taste on this version
column3: but I have no idea how some sour salt can be akin to lime.  For myself personally
column4:
I thought it tasted like "Tomato and Basil" you would find on Pita chip flavors and baked snacks.

Whether or not you agree with my above description of the flavor
column5: I would highly suggest you try to get this in a sample pack and try it out first.  BBQ + Salt & Vinegar Popchips are still my staples for now.

column1: review/text: I do enjoy most of the Popchip flavours.  This one has a nice balance and I don't get tired too quickly of this flavor.  Better than the jalapeño flavor

I even prefer it to Starbucks' colombian coffee (which I find too dark and acidic). This one I can guarantee any colombian coffee connoisseur will approve.

column1: review/text: My old cat who died last year had diabetes because I didn't understand the basic principles of feline nutrition. After he was diagnosed
column2: I switched him to a canned food diet with multiple small feedings per day
column3:
and that was actually enough to get him off insulin!

Although I would have done anything to prevent his diabetes
column4:
I didn't appreciate how unfussy it made him until he died and I got another cat. The old cat would eat anything. The new cat would starve himself to death before he'd eat something that doesn't meet his standards.

Unfortunately
column5: he's particularly fussy about canned food. He doesn't like pate-style or ground foods - if I even want there to be a prayer of him eating it
column6:
it has to have shredded meat. That's why I was so pleased to discover this brand.

First of all
column7: I love the ingredient list. The foods are balanced and grain-free (so important!) and don't contain unnecessary chemicals or preservatives. The only ingredient I'm less than thrilled about is the tapioca starch (used for thickening)
column8: but it's listed after the protein sources I really don't worry about it. When I was first considering this brand
column9: I checked out reviews for it on other websites
column10: and there were a lot of people upset that some of the flavors contain menadione. I looked into this
column11: and it's a form of vitamin K which is an essential additive in fish-based foods because they don't contain enough natural vitamin K and it's required for health. The controversy appears to be based in that it was banned for humans...after a bunch of babies died when they were given great big whopping doses. Fortunately
column12: the amount of menadione added is so minuscule that I'm totally comfortable with its inclusion. (And since it's not present in the chicken-based formulas
column13: and since I think poultry is a better staple food for cats than fish
column14:
he gets that much less of it.)

Actually
column15: the chicken and pumpkin flavor seems to be his favorite. I was a little unsure of using pumpkin
column16: since cats are carnivores and carbohydrates can have some bad effects
column17: but it's apparently good for their digestion. Since I rotate the different flavors
column18: the possible consequences are really reduced...and since cats seem to like to barf just to keep things interesting
column19:
I'm pleased about any possible stabilizing effect!

Soulistic's website also promises to use human-grade ingredients. No by-products here! It even smells like regular people food
column20: which
column21: let me tell you
column22:
is a welcome relief.

But the best part: the cat loves it. He doesn't refuse it
column23:
he's not even merely indifferent to it - he devours it. I've tried every single flavor of the "in gravy" flavors (I haven't tried the "in gelee" flavors) and every single one of them sends him into raptures.

Seriously
column24: it doesn't get any better than this. There's a canned grain-free cat food with a high moisture content and shreds or chunks of real meat and fish as the first ingredients
column25: and the cat loves it. There are enough flavors to give him variety
column26: both in taste and nutrition. I'm sold!

review/summary: Excellent odor control and soft on the paws!
review/text: I bought one bag each of the micro crystals and the Pearl crystals by Ultra Pet.  Having used Fresh Step Crystals since my two cats joined the family over a year ago
column2:
I didn't want to shock them with the switch so I tried the Pearls first as they are larger crystals. I layered the Pearls with a thin carpet of Fresh Step crystals and they seemed to take to it well enough. The odor control was equivalent (superb) to Fresh Step which is a big thumbs up from me and the two "boys".

After finishing that bag
column3: I went to the Micro Crystals.  Before I could even start to put a layer of the Fresh Step on top
column4: one of the cats leaped into the box and basically started dancing around in the litter.  I don't know if it's because of the sand-like quality compared to the hard
column5:
rough crystals but he was literally having a ball just spinning around in the box. I guess it took his brother shoving him out to go do his business for the first one to figure out it's not to play in!

All in all
column6: both products I tried were superb quality and highly absorbent with long lasting odor control.  I'll be purchasing the Micro Crystals because it's easier on MY feet considering they do tend to throw this all over the floor before they "go".  It's unfortunate that there's a 3 week shipping delay and there's no subscribe & save option.  If not for those issues
column7: I would make the full switch over to Ultra Pet litters.

column1: review/text: I was hooked on another (#1) kitty litter but due to high customer demand (or poor planning) it is periodically unavailable just when I need another order. I don't like the store brands-- either Petsmart or Petco-- so tried two bags of the Ultra Pearls (free shipping!). Not only does my 6 year old Manx like it
column2: 1-5 lb. bag lasts about 4-6 weeks using a small litter box (which my small kitty prefers). I have to have the box in the living room (behind some plants as camouflage) because she doesn't like going downstairs (as the surprises on the fireplace hearth attest). I have been pleasantly surprised that the smell is very well covered (a few minutes when it's fresh
column3: occasionally one can smell); I pick up solid waste with a saved grocery baggie and throw away. No smell and the crystals seem to last forever! Although she's small she has very healthy movements.... although the other brand is less expensive
column4: I definitely had to use the entire bag every 2 weeks (at most). For me
column5: $35 for two bags of the Ultra is well worth it. No urine smell even after several weeks; the crystals become opaque so this indicates a change of litter is necessary. I bought and used the 1st 5-lb. bag around December 6th and just poured the last half of the bag yesterday into the box after throwing out the old litter. Additionally
column6: there is very little tracking as opposed to the larger crystals which I am constantly sweeping up. For my small kitty (6 lbs) this is perfect. For larger cats or multiple cats this may not be as cost effective but may be worth a try.

It's much less scratchy on feet and the floor too. Unfortunately I will no longer be buying this litter as the price went from below $9 to $15.49 for a 5lb bag.  In comparison Just the Crystals is $17.89 for 8.8 lbs and is pretty decent for the price. If anyone knows of a store that has good prices in Northern California please leave a message in the comments. Thanks.

review/text: The advantage of the micro crystals (more absorptive surface) is also it's biggest disadvantage.  The crystals are so small and light that they get tracked all over.  They also invariably get stuck in the crevasses of the cats' paws.  I am not sure whether these crystals contributed to the irritation of the paws on one of my cats.  Odor control is good until
column2: all of a sudden

column1: review/text: I bought this tea because when summer rolls around

column4: I discovered green tea seemed to help with some of the symptoms

column9:
and I am in heaven. This is why I bought a blender!

column10: but the first few sips of this tasted like honey to me. I don't know if it actually does

column13: how you imagine a bee would taste. All bzzzz and the like. But it is sweet enough and flavorful enough that while I was drinking it at work
column14:
I kept reaching for it. I tend to place my travel mug on the corner of the desk and forget it's there until I lose my voice.

This matcha is also a good addition to my smoothies
column15: since it provides calcium and protein. As someone on a dairy-free diet
column16: the ability to get calcium in my tea is very important to me. A friend of mine says that "drinking tea for the health benefits is like having sex for the exercise
column17:
but after a summer of allergies made manageable by local honey and green tea, I'm a believer. Do I think tea is going to magically make me skinner? No. Damn it. But I do firmly believe that teas like this matcha can help with things like allergies and vitamin deficiencies. If nothing else, this tea keeps me away from carbonated drinks like Coke and Dr. Pepper....mmm, Dr. Pepper. It also helps me cut back on sugary fruit juices and heart attack causing energy drinks. Matcha is all I need to get that rush to help me make it through my day. And this particular matcha is a tasty, tasty option. I love it! A sweet green tea that makes you feel like you're drinking something that will give you superpowers? That also helps you get your vitamins and bounce around your office like you just had a large can of Red Bull? I guess these are really a love them or leave them type of product; you'll notice the very high or very low star ratings
column4:
not one 3 star review when I tasted these. I think the split is because the almonds do not have the word "seasoned" in the title so people looking for plain almonds feel duped. I also see that some people are mad about them containing MSG; it is listed clearly in the ingredient list so you can avoid it if you have problems consuming it. Some people get sick or bad headaches so this is an important thing to be aware of if you are sensitive.

I can see how someone would be put off by any flavor if they were looking for plain; my advice is to always hunt down the ingredient list to any food you are planning to buy without tasting first
column5: especially if ordering in bulk.  I went to the grocery store and got one jar of these to see if I liked them

review/text: I picked up one of these packets locally to try it for the first time.  Like most seasoning packets
column2: it is going to carry a fairly significant amount of salt (10% of your RDA
column3: according to the U.S. Nutrition Facts information)
column4: but that's about it as far as dangers from this packet are concerned.  The labeling (all in German) claims this packet makes 4 portions--but they're very generous portions; our family of 3 had more than enough to satisfy everyone
column5:
and enough left over for lunch the next day.

Basic directions (again
column6: in German) are printed on the back
column7: to wit: cut a pound of meat (beef
column8: pork or poultry) into cubes and brown in hot oil.  Add about 1 1/2 c. water
column9: bring to a boil
column10: add contents of the packet and return to boil.  Cover
column11: turn to low and cook 60-90 minutes
column12:
or until meat is tender. (Or cook in a 400 degree F oven.) Serve with potatoes.

Each packet also offers another recipe; ours had "Budapest-style" goulash on the back. Here's how that one goes: cut about a pound of pork stew meat into cubes and brown them in oil. Add a generous 1 1/2 c. water and the contents of the goulash spice packet. Bring to a boil
column13: cover
column14:
turn to low and cook for about an hour.

In a separate pan
column15: cook about 2 ounces bacon until crisp.  Drain off nearly all the fat
column16: then add two chopped onions and two chopped bell peppers (red and/or green) to the pan.  Saute for 10 minutes
column17: or until the onions start to take on some color.  Add these to the main pan along with 2 or 3 tomatoes
column18: peeled
column19: seeded and diced (or use whole canned tomatoes
column20: cut up)
column21:
and cook another 10 minutes.

We served this goulash over rice. The original called for it to be served with potato dumplings
column22: which would also be excellent.

column2: not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition

column4: but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  We particularly like that this food contains yogurt.  When she was young (~6 months old)
column5: our baby loved yogurt but couldn't eat it plain because it would cause a rash around her mouth.  She was never bothered by the yogurt in this food

column1: review/summary: An Ode to the Drink of the Gods...
review/text: This Mango Nectar is perfection! It deserves the highest praise
column2:
and I feel compelled to be the one to give it.

First
column3: it must be understood that this is a true delicacy and thus it is to be sipped and savored slowly
column4: not gulped down indiscriminately like a can of coke. If you really want to get the most out of this true little slice of heaven
column5: you have to address it unhurriedly
column6: preferably with your eyes closed. It is best served refrigerated and I like to drink it straight out of the can
column7: because even the can feels good
column8: with its slim line and nice heft. It's actually quite a bit heavier than one expects... So
column9: can or glass
column10: take a sip and gently roll it around on your tongue
column11: like you would a fine wine. Feel the thick richness of the nectar
column12: dancing its dance of subtle
column13: rich flavors in the hiddenmost recesses of your taste glands. Remember to breath gently through your mouth and nose too
column14: to get the full effect of the subtle hues of this amazing fruit's aromas. Notice the tiniest little hint of bitterness - it really rounds out the "feel" of the mango. It no doubt comes from the pulp and
column15: without it
column16:
this juice would not be nearly as delectable as it is.

Does this sound like poetry to you? Perhaps it seems like it is a somewhat overdone description of a product that is
column17: after all

review/text: I use fructose for anything that calls for sugar.  I use it in baking and for everyday items.  I feel that it is healthier for me than processed sugar.  I was pleased to find it on Amazon.com.  It is outlandishly expensive in specialty shops.
review/summary: GREAT product at an affordable price!
review/text: Contrary to what the sugar industry would love us to believe
column2: fructose is a MUCH healthier sweetener than sucrose (white table sugar
column3: evaporated cane juice).  It is NOT the same as high fructose corn syrup (HFCS
column4: by the way
column5: has nearly the same molecular structure as sucrose at right around 50% glucose to 50% fructose ... so all of the health hazards announced with HFCS apply to sucrose as well ... this applies even the sneaky "evaporated cane juice"
column6: which tries to come off as a healthier sugar alternative). Glucose hits the bloodstream fast and hard
column7: causing blood sugar to rise to very unhealthy levels
column8: which then forces the body to release chemicals (insulin
column9: adrenaline
column10: etc) in order to try and bring blood sugar levels back to normal (this reaction is what causes "sugar highs and lows".  On the flip side
column11: fructose sweeteners are processed by the organs and enter the blood stream slowly and steadily
column12: as needed.  The ONLY time fructose carries health risks is when it's combined in the diet with the HEALTH-DESTRUCTIVE sweetener; sucrose! If you eliminate sucrose (common table sugar/evaporated cane juice) from your diet and replace it with a 100% fructose sweetener (fructose
column13: agave nectar
column14: fruit
column15: fruit juice)
column16: you will get to enjoy MANY health benefits
column17: some of which are: stable glucose levels
column18: more balanced energy levels
column19: lower cholesterol
column20: cancer fighter (rather than being a cancer promoter like sucrose)
column21: etc.  I speak from the experience of many ... myself and my family included! My husband
column22: prior to switching completely to fructose and staying completely away from sucrose
column24: high cholesterol and his triglycerides were through the roof (over 900!!).  He was on medication for his diabetes
column25: but didn't want to take Lipitor. Less than a year after we were married and he was completely away from sucrose
column26: he was able to go off of his diabetes medication and his cholesterol and triglycerides were so low
column27: his doctor stated "you just took one foot out of the grave and now have the cholesterol of a fit teen" Of course
column28: common sense tells us that *all* sweets
column30:
need to be consumed in moderation ... too much of a good thing is still too much!
So don't buy into the fears that the sugar industry PAYS BIG BUCKS to breed ... buy into your health and enjoy this wonderful sweetener! It tastes like sugar and can be used just like sugar in recipes (you use about 25% less
column31: so it's easier on the calories as well).

column1: review/text: The description of this product is misleading - this fructose does NOT come from fruit but from a vegetable -CORN!  If you are following the Sugarbusters diet or diabetic in general - this will cause a sugar level issue - from the corn (starch converting to sugar) and the fructose together! Big problem!  There is nothing in online description to indicate this difference.  Found it on side panel of product when received.  The "100% granules" is misleading too - making it look like a natural product - it is not derived from 100% fruit sugar.  Do not buy if you are following a low-glycemic index diet.  Coordinating with Amazon to return.
review/summary: Very dangerous - research before you think about buying
review/text: I finally put pieces together -- why fructose had disappeared off any store shelves and I had to order it here

Fructose
column3: and high-fructose corn syrup are proving to be very dangerous
column4: causing many disruptive health problems. It's processed differently in the body than sucrose -- yes
column5: our bodies CAN tell the difference -- and while they used to think that was good
column6:
they're now finding many ways in which it is bad.

This is not returnable
column7: so when I received my (2nd) order
column8: I dumped it in the dumpster. It caused "non-alcoholic fatty liver disease"
column9: intense intestinal swelling and distress
column10: highly-elevated blood pressure
column11:
and other problems that indicate these warnings were getting more serious.

If this is from corn and not fruit
column12: it's even more dangerous. (Thank you
column13: reviewer "Debe".) Really check this out through Google

column15: before considering adding it into your life.

column7:
I feel more comfortable and better able to focus on feeling comfortable because the muscles all throughout my body seem to be content to be in "off" mode; they are not as easily excitable as they are on my previously magnesium-deficient diet.

column1: review/summary: Yummy way to save your teeth

review/text: Let's face it. No one wants to get bad news from the dentist. Proper dental care can go a long way to keeping one's teeth for a lifetime.

The generation that grew up in the Depression and World War II many times did not have good dental care. No fluoride
column2: sealants
column3: waterpiks
column4: sonic toothbrushes and the like.  It wasn't uncommon for a person in their 30s to be missing a few teeth.  People generally could look forward to wearing dentures as their teeth became so rotten
column5:
the only thing to do was to pull them.

Today
column6: we don't have such problems.  And one of the reasons is the use of xylitol to help kill the bacteria that cause tooth decay.  The main reason for dental decay is a bacterium called S. Mutans.  This bug feeds on sugars and starches
column7: secreting acids which destroy tooth enamel
column8: which leads to decay and cavities.  There are various ways to defeat this bug
column9: brushing
column10: fluoride
column11:
flossing and sealants all have their place.

A more modern addition to the decay-preventing fight is xylitol. It's a sugar alcohol that S. Mutans cannot digest. Sucking on mints or chewing gum with xylitol a few times a day is a easy and tasty way to curb this nasty bacteria.

I've been chewing xylitol gum and eating xylitol mints for a number of years
column12:
and I've noticed that my dental problems have really improved.

Highly recommended. My only complaint is that this gum is so delicious
column13: I tend not to ration it to make it last longer.  Try Spry.  Your mouth will thank you for it.  (Maybe not your dentist
column14: though).

column5: shipped to Orem

column7:
Mints and Candies are all made in China. The rest of our products are made here in the states. I hope that was the information you were looking for. Have a nice day!

Xlear Inc."

column8:

column9: we have big problems with our own FDA)...it is still unethical in my opinion. Deceptive

what follows is from wiki:

Xylitol is a "toothfriendly" sugar. In addition to not encouraging tooth decay (by replacing dietary sugars)
column15: xylitol may actively aid in repairing minor cavities caused by dental caries.[citation needed] Early studies from Finland in the 1970s found that a group chewing sucrose gum had 2.92 decayed
column16: missing
column17: or filled (dmf) teeth compared to 1.04 in the group chewing xylitol gums. In another study
column18: researchers had mothers chew xylitol gum 3 months after delivery until their children were 2 years old. The researchers found that the xylitol group had "a 70% reduction in caries (dmf)." Recent research confirms a plaque-reducing effect and suggests that the compound
column19: having some chemical properties similar to sucrose
column20: attracts and then "starves" harmful micro-organisms
column21: allowing the mouth to remineralize damaged teeth with less interruption. (However

review/text: This has amazing taste! Even though there have been double blind studies showing it reduces cavities xylitol is controversial. I chew it because I have low saliva production. Ten minutes every hour
column2: ten hours a day increases saliva production
column3: which protects gums and teeth. It is thought that mouth bacteria can't ferment it
column4:
which is the reason it reduces cavities.

Xylitol to dogs is deadly
column5: so I am very careful to keep Xlear Spry gum where they can NEVER get to it
column6: and disposing the used gum into the trash out in the garage. In dogs
column7: Xylitol is toxic. Just 3 grams can kill a 65 pound dog. In about 30 minutes (give or take) of a dog eating something containing xylitol
column8: their blood sugar begins droping to dangerous levels. Symptoms are weakness
column9: lethargy
column10: loss of coordination
column11: collapse and seizures. An IMMEDIATE trip to the vet is needed
column12:
otherwise there is little chance your dog will survive. This doesn't affect cats.

Another thing to consider with xylitol
column13: is that it does thin the blood in humans. People on blood thinners
column14:
such as myself should consult their doctors before consuming Xlear Spry or any xylitol containing items.

That said

column1: review/summary: Tasty orange soda - zero cal - and all-natural!

review/text: I happen to be drinking an Orange Zevia as I write this review. :)

I cannot compliment this brand enough. I've been purchasing all flavors of Zevia for the past few years and absolutely love it. There isn't an aftertaste at all
column2: and it is simply delicious.  Zevia's Natural Orange is among my favorite flavors.  My other Zevia favorites are black cherry and root beer
column3:
however all their flavors are yummy!

My favorite things about Zevia are that they are sweetened with all-natural stevia and do not contain any harmful chemicals. Also
column4:
I love the fact that there are not any calories in it. There are no artificial colors or flavors either.

The only Zevia flavor I've seen caffeine in is cola. All the others are caffeine-free.

I deducted a star from this product due to the pricey price point of Zevia. I still continue to buy it
column5:
but not as often as I would like to due to the cost.

I have emailed the Zevia corporate team and they are responsive
column6: professional
column7:
and friendly. I trust this brand.

I hope you give Zevia a try. I think you will be pleased!

column2: this soda just doesn't taste good in orange flavor. It has a strange flavor

definitely not something I would want to pay extra for.

The black cherry flavor of Zevia is much better
column5: really very nice.

review/text: I found this product to be unacceptable.
The first criticism goes to the flavor which I found to be missing. The product is supposed to have an orange flavor. I find it very weak. I prefer a more robust flavor. Secondly
column2: to put it as delicately as I can

column1: review/summary: Orange Soda without worry about Sugar Elevation-PERFECT FOR HCG DIET
review/text: What distinguishes this soda from the other diet soda's is that it does NOT elevate your blood sugars. Despite the fact that there are other Zero calorie soda's

they have Aspertame or Splenda which DOES raise your blood sugar levels - so this is really the best soda for those who have this concern.

Also
column3: unless you are truly living without sugar
column4:
this soda won't taste as good to you as others. It tastes MUCH better when you aren't ingesting either sugar or sugar substitutes.

Best thing - EVERYTHING IN THIS IS ALL NATURAL!! Enjoy:)

column1: review/summary: Love this beverage...but don't have it shipped to you.
review/text: My family loves this soda.  We sometimes buy it from a nearby grocery store.  HOWEVER
column2: I had it shipped from Amazon and it is no good.  I believe that somewhere in the process of getting to my home the Zevia Orange may be getting too hot.  It was very hot weather the first time it was shipped to me.  It really tastes weird...not like when we buy if off the shelf.  I tried again in cold weather this time and though it's not as bad
column3: it is still no good. It has an odd bite to it that I assume comes from it getting too warm.  It alters the beverage and cooling it in the frig does not reverse it.

column1: review/summary: If Stevia is bitter for you
column2: then this is the better tasting Zevia drinks

column1: review/text: Because of my genetics Stevia will always be bitter to me. I've tried other artificial sweeteners and stevia is by far the worse in bitterness no matter what brand I try.  I get no sweet taste at all. However
column2: I have to limit my sugar intake
column3: and sometimes I just get tired of other drinks
column4: especially the carbonated ones. I like the orange Zevia because with the bitter Stevia taste it reminds me a lot of the "bitter orange" or lightly sweetened orange sodas that I got in Europe. I haven't tried the lemon or lime flavors
column5: but I imagine the citrus lends itself well to the bitter flavor.

column1: review/summary: I don't drink Orange Soda but I do Now!

review/text: So I had to try this flavor as I like the other two ZEVIA Natural Cola - With Stevia (Case of 24) and ZEVIA Natural Twist - With Stevia (Case of 24).

I haven't drank Orange Soda since I was a kid and for some reason I don't remember really liking Orange Crush but Zevia Orange is great and my kids love it as well.

review/text: Zevia orange really tastes like orange soda - and not like orange DIET soda either. How did they do it? I'm impressed. I wasn't a fan of orange flavored soda until now. This is so great! The cola and lemon-lime are delicious
column2: too. All this and all natural - I'll never drink a diet soda again.

column1: review/text: I was never an orange soda fan until Zevia.  It is All Natural which is important to me.  There are no artificial sweeteners or ingredients.  The taste is more subtle and refreshing then other orange sodas.  A terrific product that I highly recomend.  Try it!
review/text: I took a chance and ordered a case of this

column1: review/text: I love Zevia.  Can't say anything bad about a soda with no calories
column2: no caffeine
column3: and no aspartame.  My most recent shipment however
column4: was less than satisfactory.  One case had a can that had ruptured
column5: soaking the inside of the box
column6: and the cardboard had begun to mold as a result.  Yuck.  It was not a particularly hot day when it was delivered
column7:
between that and the mold I'm sure the can burst long before it arrived at my door.

Another case not only had a ruptured can
column8: but was missing one as well!  One of the four sixpacks had only five cans
column9:
and an empty plastic ring where a sixth should have been.

Maybe the packagers got thirsty.

column1: review/text: When I was a kid
column2: I loved Orange Crush.  Now
column3: I don't drink soda with sugar and diet sodas contain a chemical sweetener of some sort that generally taste like crap.  Not this one!  It contains Stevia which is a plant that is naturally sweet but calorie free
column4: no diabetic impact
column5: etc etc.  It also uses Erythritol for sweetness which is a sugar alcohol.  I like the taste
column6: it doesn't rot my teeth
column7: and it doesn't make me sluggish or fat.  The one downside is the price.  Economies of scale rule the beverage business
column8: and Zevia is a small player.  The product benefits offset the price in my mind and using Amazon Subscribe & Save offsets some of the cost.  That is certainly the cheapest way to get Zevia.

column2: Bill

column1: review/text: This soda has the most marvelous orange flavor with no poisonous colorings or additives of any kind and the water  is triple filtered.It is also clean tasting with a fine quenching pull in its after taste. It is simply the finest diet soda I have  tried and you can  feel the difference. A well balanced treat and worth the extra cost.Hands down.
review/summary: Not as Good as Cola or Root Beer Flavors

review/text: This is the first Zevia flavor I got to try.  I didn't really want it but it was all Amazon had in stock and ready to ship for Prime members (more on that later).  I was so eager to try it I popped a can open right when I got it in the house.  My initial thought was that it was gross but I thought I could get used to it by the time I get through the entire case.  My wife tried it at room temperature and she hated it.  She didn't touch anymore orange or the black cherry I got later because of that first taste.  She's since had some nice cold root beer and cola Zevia which she was impressed with.  My nearly three year old son also had a taste test of the orange flavor.  He's not a soda drinker so maybe that had something to do with his reaction.  He drank about an 1/8 of a can which surprisingly all came back up on my kitchen floor about two minutes after he drank it.  He said he didn't like it.  Ha.  Out of the four flavors of Zevia
column2: orange is my least favorite.  I will not be ordering it again due in part to its taste
column3: which I would say is okay
column4: but also the price for it.  I am willing to pay the price for now for a couple of the other flavors
column5:
but not orange.

There are two major problems with ordering Zevia products. First
column6: they're expensive.  At just over a dollar a can they are pricey
column7: no other way to describe it.  The second
column8:
is availability. Amazon is really having some issues with keeping Zevia flavors in stock with Prime shipping. The third party sellers all have exuberant shipping prices bringing your case of soda to over fifty dollars. I've emailed Zevia about this and did get a response from them. I hope Amazon can keep it stocked and Zevia can keep them supplied. It's a good product but it's been frustrating trying to order due to Amazon's stock. Due to the high price tag I put it on a monthly schedule to save 15%. It helps but I wonder if Amazon will have it ready to go each month.

The Zevia Orange is an okay tasting soda. I will not be purchasing any more of it even if it's all Amazon Prime has in stock.

column1: review/text: I have tried a few of the Zevias and this orange one is really pretty good and refreshing if you don't want to give up your sodas because of all the unhealthy things in them

column1: review/text: Good Product and shipped in a timely manner.  I tried to make another order through Amazon with the coupon but it would not accept the coupon code.  So I won't order again until i figure it out.  If anyone can advise on what to do.  I tried calling Zevia but could not get through to any human so I gave up.

column1: review/summary: Good Stuff! Not Overly Sweet!!

column2: ..I'm speaking on behalf of the Orange Soda here. When I first popped the tab and drank a sip of the Zevia Orange

column4:
but just surprised a bit by the unexpected lack of sweetness.

Now
column5: with that being said
column6: ...and a few cans later
column7: ..this has quickly become my "go to" drink when I want a refreshing orange soda. It is very good and very quenching (due to the noticeable lack of sodium) on a hot summer day. The aroma is wonderful and the flavor is very close to as real as you can get before drinking straight orange oil. It's a really good soda and I'm now tempted to try the Root Beer and the Cola.

column1: review/summary: Better than Sunkist and Orangina!
review/text: Ever since I learned about the dangers of sugar and chemical sugars
column2: I have avoided them like the plague.  Then when I accidentally discovered an online ad for a "stevia-sweetened" soft drink named Zevia
column3: well
column4:
let's just say I was hooked.

Zevia is an alternative to diet soda that is sweetened with my two favorite sweeteners: erythritol and stevia. Wow! There is no calcium-removing phosphoric acid like you'd find in regular toxic sodas. And the taste is great! I've only tried the Orange and Natural Twist flavors with Orange being my favorite so far. I hear they came out with a new root beer flavor so that makes a total of four different Zevia sodas to choose from.

Diabetics and those with Candida will welcome this new alternative to soda. I know me and my father sure did. Can't wait to open a nice cold one right after I write this review. Ahhhhhh!

review/text: The Picture makes this look awesome. It was on amazon lighting deals and we were so excited to give my parents this for Christmas.

So you are paying 30 bucks for a 2 dollar basket and a 50 cent bow and the time it took them to "slap" it together.

And you CANNOT RETURN IT TO AMAZON AS A FOOD ITEM.

This was a horrible purchase and product!

review/summary: Great Extract with Lovely Lemon Flavor
review/text: I was hesitant to buy a larger bottle at first because I had read some reviews regarding a clear bottle and a decrease in quality from OliveNation
column2:
so I bought the smallest container to try it out. I encourage you to ignore the previous review about there being alcohol in the extract: all extracts are suspended in alcohol- normally an pure fruit oil and alcohol mixture.

Anyways
column3:
the extracts were well packaged and shipped quickly. I was pleased to find that the 4 oz container is tinted glass and the aroma is superb. I have used the extract in various baked goods and it provides a lovely hint of lemon.

The only con about this item is that it is very subtle. I need to add what seems to me to be a lot of extract to get the dominate lemon flavor in things like lemon poppy seed muffins.

I would absolutely recommend this product to anyone who is in short supply of fresh lemon juice. This makes an excellent substitution.

column1: review/text: I got this one special for my boyfriend as a surprise. Last time he got to pick out a matcha
column2: we ended up with Cola
column3:
so this time I thought an alcoholic drink matcha was in order. More sophisticated? Well - more adult anyways ;)

He is loving the flavoured matcha as much (if not more!) than I do! This one smelled sweet from the get go - creamy and .. tangy? Smoky? Not smoky! I'm trying to describe what irish cream smells like - it doesn't have the smokiness of whisky - but it definitely is sweet and creamy! I knew it was going to be a real treat - just like the real thing!

What a neat flavour experience! I prepared the matcha straight and thick for the first bowl. In this state I tasted mostly matcha with an aftertaste of sweet cream that lingered after finishing the bowl. It was very creamy and pleasant.

Next I tried it over ice with 18% cream and sugar. I thought my eyes were going to roll into the back of my head and be lost forever! This was mine and Mike's favourite way to enjoy it. It's sweet
column4: but because you have control over the amount of sugar
column5:
it's not crazy sweet and cloying. You could probably enjoy cup after cup with the only buzz coming from the energy of all that matcha you're drinking!

This one is so so good mixed with the Madagascar Vanilla matcha - it just adds a bit of something that takes the creamy flavour over the top. Come St. Patricks day
column6:
it would be an awesome drink to mix with mint matcha (Mint is on the way in the mail as we speak!) and hey - it's already green! No need to add any food colouring for your Paddy experience ;)

Now - if a Guinness Matcha ever comes out - I know the perfect one to mix it with ;)

column1: review/summary: Why did Campbell's discontinue such a great product?

review/text: My kids were raised on this soup every Friday night for years on end. But not Beefy Mushroom by itself; it was always mixed with 2 cans of Cream of Potato soup and served over potato sticks.
Here is the recipe for Logjam soup:
1 can Beefy Mushroom rinsed with one can water.
1 can Cream of Potato rinsed with one can water (can be milk if you prefer creamier soup).
1 can Cream of Potato rinsed with one can milk.
Stir over med heat. When hot ladle over potato sticks
column2:
then
sprinkle with paprika.
If the food gurus at Campbell's ever ate one bowl of this soup combination they would be ashamed of themselves for discontinuing the Beefy Mushroom.
Glenn

The taste of this herbal tea is interesting: it's got a hint of sweetness with a very slight medicinal bitterness. Feels quite dry and alkaline to me. Color is light brown. Not particularly delightful or tasty
column2: neither does it have a strong
column3: captivating aroma like the Japanese roasted green tea - it's just weird beyond description. Reminds me of dried summer leaves. Not unpleasant though; I am still glad that I tried it!

review/text: I watched Dr. OZ on television and he was explaining how to minimize and/or avoid crows feet. His advice? Drinking Fenugreek tea
column2: taking L-Arginine supplements and getting a good nights' sleep (6 hour min.). Well
column3: I am going to give it a shot. This tea has an interesting taste-not your typical tea but not bad. It tastes pretty good with a bit of honey added actually. I wasn't able to find this tea in any local supermarkets but here it is on Amazon. Seems they have everything!

column2: Great Price

I was kind of disappointed.  It doesn't smell as bad as some of the other reviewers made it out to me but then again my nose has been wonky for some time so it could be me.  Yes I will admit that it does has a funky odor but it is not that strong to me.  To me

review/summary: My tiny dog loves Zuke's treats  !!!

review/text: My tiny Maltese dog loves these treats and they are perfect for training sessions.  They are small/miniature treats and about the consistancy of a 'slim jim' jerky stick. Best treats I have found for toy dogs that don't crumble.

review/text: I adopted a 1 year old Yorkie rescue pup who is only semi potty trained. I was having some troubles getting him to potty outside today (like most days). Then these awesome treats arrived! I ordered the Zukes mini naturals roasted chicken treats last night and they were already here this morning with Prime. I gave him one to taste test and he gobbled it up and instantly wanted another. I then grabbed two of them
column2: went outside with him knowing I had the treats in hand and I asked him to go potty. He went instantly! I think tasty treats really do make a big difference. These are also nice and small so giving them a few isn't going to pile on the pounds. We are feeding our pups a grain free dog food so it only makes sense to get grain free treats too. I will be back for more of these for sure both of my pups LOVE these!!!

column1:
review/text: My dog loves these and they're my training treats of choice. I've only tried the chicken flavor.

They're semi-moist
column2: not messy
column3: and pretty small.  They're not scored

column5: you can cut them down into really tiny bits and still make a dog happy.  If you quarter them
column6:
you could give 20 rewards during training and only be adding 15 calories.

The bag has a reclosable seal

I put precut treats in a snack-sized zip bag to keep them fresh.

column6: but she was absolutely neither. Apart from great advice on aspca.org

review/text: We adopted a 10 month mix breed and needed to tap into his hunting breed's tendencies and these treats are the only reason our guy gets excited about training and hunting for treats.

We ordered a Kong Wobbler too and these treats are the perfect size and shape to put inside and keep him entertained for awhile. They're great for having on hand just as treats or as rewards while working on training. You can carry alot and it not be awkward.

He loves the chicken flavor and can't seem to get enough. I love the price for the size of the bag you get and they last a good while as long as you ration. Even though they are definitely "mini"
column2:
each one has such a strong (not overwhelming) aroma and taste that just that little morsel is enough for our big guy. His nose knows.

I'm ordering more today and will continue to order as long as they're available. Just wish they were on auto delivery. We'd never want to run out. Any other treat just won't do. I highly recommend you at least try them. You and your pooch will be glad you did.

Do be careful in how you store it as it will dry out if exposed to too much air.

I recommend them to my students because of the quality and convenience.

column1: review/summary: Leo would walk through fire for salmon
column2: through rain for peanut butter

column1: review/text: I bought Zuke's mini treats in Salmon (and then in peanut butter) to re-enforce good walking behavior for my Australian Cattle Dog
column2: Leo.  I liked the fact that they had no added chemicals and were only 2 calories each. They are similar in texture to <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004D2578G">Pup-Peroni Original Beef Recipe
column3: 5.6-Ounces (Pack of 4)
column4: but they do not contain by-products
column5: corn syrup
column6: onion powder (onions are toxic to dogs)
column7: or nitrates like Pup-Peroni does.  They are cut to a good size--like a pencil's eraser-- a dog does not need to eat a whole stick for a treat-- 2 seconds of flavor is 2 seconds whether its a mini treat or a stick swallowed whole.  They do dry a little over time
column8: but that's because they keep the preservatives to a minimum.  Leo definitely does not seem to mind the texture change
column9:
and they retain the very strong salmon smell Leo loves.

I do
column10: however
column11: have one caveat for dog parents who plan to give these as training treats. For Leo
column12: the salmon minis are what the trainers on TV call "high value" treats. It took 2 weeks for me to use them on walks at all because they made Leo too excited to walk!  When I opened our first bag
column13: the scent hit his nostrils in the next room and he came running to me in the kitchen
column14: as if I were cooking fish or s roast. I made the mistake of saying
column15: "I think the mail man brought a present for Leo
column16:
and he immediately started running through his entire repertoire--small though it is. He tried to sit, lie down, sit, shake with the normal paw, shake with the other paw, lie down again, sit again--you get the picture.  I actually had to spend 2 weeks training him how to calm down enough to receive this treat! I still cannot let him use his teeth to take the treat because he is too excited and will inadvertently nip my fingers or the skin of my palm--I trained him to take it with his tongue.  He thinks the peanut butter are wonderful, but he does not become apoplectic for them.  I use the peanut butter for walking treats--he loves them enough to walk properly, even when it's raining.  I save the salmon for dessert and to motivate him to stay calm in difficult situations, like bath day.

column2:
"Mini Naturals" are the only treat that I give to my dog. I prefer them for several reasons:

1) Ingredients: When you buy any food or treat for your dog
column3:
it is always important to look at the ingredients and the first ingredient especially. The first ingredient in the chicken flavored mini naturals is chicken. In a lot of other treats it is something less nutritious like sugar or corn meal.

2) Calories: I have a dog that gains weight easily. Each mini natural has only 3 calories. Many other treats have 15. My dog has lost a little weight since I switched from the other treats I was using to mini naturals. Although the treats are small in size
column4:
they are large and tasty enough to get my dog to do what I want him to do (most of the time).

3) Flavor: My dog seems to like the chicken flavor the most. He will eat the others but definitely seems to notice the difference and have a preference for chicken. They all look the same to us but maybe not to our dogs.

4) Buying on Amazon: I have been buying mine at a health pet food store. But I was pleased to notice that it is actually a better deal to buy them on Amazon. I will be doing this in the future.

column13: ground rice

review/text: I received the Zukes Chicken Mini's a couple of days ago. I opened the bag and the smell that came out of it was a sour almost vinegar smell
column2:
much like pickles in away. I fed the dogs one each then thought I better not give them anymore. I emailed the company and asked if that was normal. Matt the contact sent this message:

Hi Kerrie-

They are definitely strong in smell. If you have not smelled them before
they may seem a little odd smelling. The dogs think they are candy! They
should be perfectly fine. One thing to check is the bottom/underside of
the bag and make sure the "best by" date is still good. If that is in
range I would say everything is good to feed to your dog. Thank You for
your inquiry and for supporting Zuke's!

Matt Porray
"Bone Counselor"
Customer Service
Zuke's

They date on the bag is for November 2013 so they are well within the expiration date.
But I emailed a friend (who in the past has donated many bags of Zukes treats to the dog club I used to belong for training classes) and I asked her the same question she felt they were not safe to feed with them smelling sour (vinegar like). I had never fed the chicken flavor before.
I think Iwill be sending these back. I am very disappointed

review/summary: Perfect!
review/text: The Zuke's Chicken Flavored Treats are just what I was hoping they would be! I got the chicken flavor (despite other claims of serious odor) because it was the cheapest flavor. My dog LOVES them. Her affinity for them, coupled with their size makes them perfect for training.  They are small little cylinders which are about 1/4 thick and less than 1/2" wide. They are enough to keep her interest
column3: but not too substantial that they distract from training as she's chewing
column4: as usually happens with a biscuit-type treat. They are also great for use inside the Kong Genius Leo (I have a size Large). They are thinner than a similar treat by a different brand which I found at my local Petco. I like that they're smaller because the other ones would get stuck in the tube of the Leo. These slide in and out without much friction at all. I don't find the odor to be as offensive as others have described. The odor is about average for moist treats
column5: in my opinion. In fact
column6: they smell very similar to my cat's treats.  So much so that my cat tries to steal them when I lay them on the floor while the dog is practicing "stay."  Also
column7: you really can't beat the value! Treats can go so quickly when used during training and it's nice to find a quality treat that doesn't break the bank! I will definitely be buying these again!

review/summary: Great rewards for clicker training

review/text: Length:: 1:42 Mins

I have been clicker training Bella
column2: a toy Yorkshire Terrier
column3: for about 3 years.  Now that she has a baby sister (Bleu
column4: a miniature Blue Heeler) I started to look for a new type of treat to help reinforce the training.  When Bella was little I used small pieces of hot dogs but I wanted to switch to something healthier.  Zuke's mini treats seem to work really well.  I use the chicken flavored ones and I am really impressed with both how much the dogs like them and how much they smell like real food.  I thought that I would make this quick video to show the treats (and my dogs) in action.

column1: review/text: Our dogs love chicken so
column2: after reading all of the positive reviews and noting that the first ingredient was chicken
column3:
I was really hopeful that these would be their new favorite treat. They sometimes will play with them for a minute but will not eat them and are not the least bit excited about them. They even lost interest in the sound of the treat jar that normally gets them very excited. These treats feel and look more like a wad of gelatin than chicken and have been relegated to the trash bin. They would be a little on the expensive side if they actually were mostly chicken but they are way overpriced for sort of chicken gel wads.

While almost everything "tastes like chicken" these treats don't
column4: as evidenced by the fact that our chicken-loving dogs do not like them one bit.

column1: review/summary: would be okay if they didnt get hard after 5 minutes

review/text: I originally bought the Zuke's Treats for Cats on Amazon.com. It arrived in a decent amount of time (I didn't expect it to be quick since I used the free shipping). My cat thought they were just okay
column2: and would eat them if i put them in front of her
column3: but not come running as she does for her other treats. So I would leave them out for her in her dish
column4: and they would get hard real quick. After maybe eating 20 of the little pieces total
column5:
she stopped eating them altogether.
Then I went to Petco after adopting a puppy
column6: and Petco convinced me they would be perfect for training so i got the ones for dogs. I thought maybe the shipping made them stale
column7: and Petco assured me the ones for dogs were of better quality. Unfortunately this was not the case
column8: my dog who eats shoes
column9: and ANYTHHING else that's on the floor does not want to eat these. I mean they are okay but barely okay. When I take her on walks and use them to redirect her attention and they are hard by the time we get home from our walk
column10: and she will spit out over half of them on the sidewalk. So if your pet likes hard food then they might like them (and they are real ingredients
column11: ) but if your pet is like mine
column12: they wont touch them. I now have two barely opened packages of this stuff that just sits under my cupboard.

column1: review/summary: my dogs love the peanut butter!

column2: read the ingredients
column3: no crazy words I can't pronounce
column4: which means it's all natural! I got the peanut butter treats for my two children: husky/shepherd and a lab/shepherd mix
column5: and they can't get enough of them. Plus
column6: on Amazon
column7: this is such a great value for 16oz. Beats petsmart for sure! I'll be looking for more Zuke's products now that I've discovered them. Thanks Zuke's!
